thread.title: CTIA-The Wireless Association Announces 2015 CTIA Awards Winners
thread.title_full: CTIA-The Wireless Association Announces 2015 CTIA Awards Winners

author: admin
title: CTIA-The Wireless Association Announces 2015 CTIA Awards Winners
text:
CTIA-The Wireless Association 
LAS VEGAS, Sept. 10, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- On day two of Super Mobility 2015 , CTIA-The Wireless Association® announced the winners of the Emerging Technology (E-Tech) Awards, Hot for the Holidays Awards and the MobITs Awards. 
http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnvar/20140226/DC72266LOGO 
The E-Tech Awards winners represent the most innovative emerging mobile services, solutions and technology from areas such as the cloud, network equipment, M2M and the Internet of Things. The Hot for the Holidays Awards recognize the hottest mobile consumer electronics-- including gadgets and accessories from entertainment and health to the connected car and home--just in time for the holiday shopping season. The MobITs Awards represent the most innovative IT solutions that help companies secure their operations and improve their customers' experience by enhancing performance, efficiency and productivity. 
Industry experts, analysts and media judged the hundreds of entries across CTIA's three programs to determine the finalists and winners. AT&T Mobile and Business Solutions Wi-Fi - Small Site, Synchronoss Mobile Content Transfer and AT&T Mobile and Business Solutions Modio LTE Case were the "Crowd Favorites" that represent the favorite products of Super Mobility 2015 attendees and online users. 
The 2015 CTIA E-Tech Awards winners (first, second and third place) are: 
In-Building Wireless--Small Cell, Wi-Fi, LAN 1. AT&T Mobile and Business Solutions, AT&T Wi-Fi - Small Site 2. Xirrus, Inc., Xirrus Xtreme Density (XD4) Wi-Fi 3. Airvana, S1000 LTE and Dual-Band Wi-Fi SMB Small Cell 
M2M, IoT, Sensors, RFID & NFC 1. Atheer, Atheer AiR Smart Glasses platform 2. Ossia, Cota 3. Qualcomm Incorporated, Qualcomm® Snapdragon SenseTM ID 3D Fingerprint Technology 
Mobile Cloud 1. Rave Mobile Safety, Smart911 Location Cloud 2. Azuga Fleet, Azuga Fleet Driver Rewards App 3. Tangoe, MatrixCloud 
Mobile Money, Payments, Banking & Commerce 1. Blackhawk Network, GoWallet 2. Panasonic System Communications Company North America, Toughpad® FZ-R1 3. Invoice2go, Invoice2go 
Wide Area Network 1. Plug Power, ReliOn Integrated Outside Plant solution with GenFuel 2. ItsOn, Inc, The ItsOn Platform 3. Parallel Wireless, Inc., Enabling RAN Hyperconnectivity with HetNet Gateway 
E-Tech Crowd Favorite: AT&T Mobile and Business Solutions, AT&T Wi-Fi - Small Site 
The 2015 Hot for the Holidays Awards winners (first, second and third place) are: 
Accessories 1. Ztylus, Ztylus Metal Camera Kit for iPhone 6/6+ (Premium Case and 4 in 1 Revolver Lens Attachment) 2. Scosche Industries, Inc., Scosche goBATTM 12000 3. Otter Products, LifeProof FRE Power 
Connected Car 1. splitsecnd , splitsecnd 2. Cobra Electronics , CDR 855 BT Drive HDTM Dash Cam by Cobra 3. Directed, Viper SmartStart 4.0 
Connected Home 1. Sengled, Sengled Snap 2. Piper by Icontrol Networks, Piper nv 3. Lineage Labs, Bevy 
Devices & Gadgets 1. Samsung, Samsung Galaxy S 6 edge 2. Edyn, Edyn Smart Garden Sensor 3. Intel Corporation, ASUS ZenFone 2 (ZE551ML) Powered by Intel 
Entertainment, Audio, Music & Video 1. Sengled, Sengled Pulse 2. Wearality Corporation, Wearality Sky (TM) 3. Samsung, Samsung Gear VR Innovator Edition 
Wearables, Health, Fitness & Wellness 1. Microsoft, Microsoft Band 2. Aeris Communications, GPS SmartSoles 3. Samsung, Samsung Gear S 
Hot for the Holidays Crowd Favorite: AT&T Mobile and Business Solutions, AT&T Modio LTE Case 
The 2015 CTIA MobITs Awards winners (first, second and third place) are: 
Mobile Applications, Development & Platforms 1. Kony, Inc., Kony MobileFabric 2. BlackBerry, BlackBerry Blend 3. KORE, KORE's 3rd Generation PRiSMPro 4. Geotab, Geotab Marketplace and application development platform 5. LifeSafe, Inc., LifeSafe, Inc. 
Mobile Customer Experience Management 1. Ericsson, Ericsson Expert Analytics 15.0 2. Synchronoss, Synchronoss Mobile Content Transfer 3. LogMeIn, Rescue Lens 4. SAP Mobile Services, SAP Intelligent Notification 365 5. Hotel Internet Services, BeyondTV Wireles Streaming System 
Mobile Device Management 1. AirWatch, AirWatch by VMware Enterprise Mobility Management Version 8.0 2. Citrix, Citrix XenMobile 3. AT&T Mobile and Business Solutions, AT&T Work Platform 4. SOTI, SOTI MobiControl 12 5. BlackBerry, BES®12 Cloud 
Mobile Enterprise Innovation 1. sigmo, Virtual SIMTM for Smartphone 2. AirWatch, AirWatch by VMware Enterprise Mobility Management Version 8.0 3. INRIX, INRIX Intermodal and EV Navigation 4. Hypori, Inc., Hypori Android Cloud Environment (ACE) 5. Good Technology, Good Work 
Mobile Security & Privacy 1. BlackBerry, WatchDox by BlackBerry 2. Arxan Technologies, Arxan expanded application protection for all major IoT platforms 3. Data Theorem, Data Theorem Scan & Secures 4. mSIGNIA, mSIGNIA's iDNATM Platform 5. Cellrox Ltd., Cellrox Mobile Virtualization 
MobITS Crowd Favorite: Synchronoss, Synchronoss Mobile Content Transfer 
About CTIA Shows 
CTIA Shows bring together all industries advanced by wireless technology for intense business, learning and networking. Super Mobility Week (www.supermobilityweek.com) takes place Sept. 9, 10 and 11, 2014 at the Sands Expo and Convention Center in Las Vegas. Twitter: @ctiashows | Facebook: www.ctiashows.com/facebook | LinkedIn: www.ctiashows.com/linkedin 
CTIA-The Wireless Association® ( www.ctia.org ) represents the U.S. wireless communications industry. With members from wireless carriers and their suppliers to providers and manufacturers of wireless data services and products, the association brings together a dynamic group of companies that enable consumers to lead a 21st century connected life. CTIA members benefit from its vigorous advocacy at all levels of government for policies that foster the continued innovation, investment and economic impact of America's competitive and world-leading mobile ecosystem. The association also coordinates the industry's voluntary best practices and initiatives and convenes the industry's leading wireless tradeshow. CTIA was founded in 1984 and is based in Washington, D.C.
